intro: Platanthera chlorantha f. lancifolia, commonly known as the lancifoliate green twayblade, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is adapted to moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and bogs, where it forms symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi. Its lance-shaped leaves are a distinguishing feature of this particular form. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
